comment: I loved Dr. Way's class. I could truly tell he was interested in what he was teaching, and he made me interested. While there were a couple of hours a reading outside of class, the note checks held me accountable, which I appreciated. I enjoyed the few short papers we had, and I can't wait to take him for Ga History next semester.

has mandatory note checks that must be within his "standards" i made separate notes specifically for the checks. complete crap. other then that tests are easy, attendance is mandatory, miss more then 5 classes and -10 overall points. lectures are interesting if you like the topic. gets mad if you are on your phone. only take if good time slot.

Lectures a lot in class. Three quizzes (35 MC and 5 Essay Questions). Five graded notes checks over the matieral he assigns. Two paper-like assignments, and in class writing assignments. Overall, good professor that clearly has a passion for teaching history.

Dr. Way is fantastic. His History of Georgia course was fascinating, and you could tell he made a big effort to get students talking. The reading was medium-heavy, but he is a very generous grader on the essays, tests and pop quizzes. Definitely take his class!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Way is a great person but his class was tough. You must get the books or you will fail! He gives a popquiz every week over the readings and they are not easy if you do not read. Test are mid but you must study. He is not a light grader on essays. Test are in person and you can miss 3 class before grade is effected.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Way is a great professor and is caring. However, he is a tough grader when it came to papers. He is willing to help. Also, on the exams study the terms that you'll least likely think will be on the test.

his class is lecture-based but he loves to talk about these topics and he considers a class where people participate and interrupt him with questions. Pop quizzes (but you can really guess when they are) textbook was ok, just read it and you'll be fine. He is a very lenient grader with everything. Only write two papers. Take his class if you can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: In all honesty he's a great professor, but he can be a tough grader on the papers. However, he is accessible if you need help on your papers

Professor Way is cool and accessible outside of class, but hes a tough grader on papers and has a higher page requirement for the final paper than some of the other research seminars. Overall a good class, just make sure to always read feedback and to do all the readings!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--So many papers

comment: Dr. Way is very knowledgable in the field of Georgia history. His lectures are phenomenal, and you can tell he has put a lot of work into the construction of his course. I would recommend taking Dr. Way. You have to be willing to work hard for your grade, but the knowledge and skills you will gain from his course will be worth the hard work.

Professor Way is very knowledgable in the courses he teaches. However, this class is just unnecessarly hard. All the class is is lectures. You will have a midterm,final, and 2 essays along with a quiz every week. Attendance is required, actually. He is a really tough grader, however he never really sets any expectations or requirements.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: His pop quizzes only exist to punish people who are absent, which is stupid because he also takes off points for missing class. 40% of your grade comes from 2 exams. You will not get above a C on exam 1 no matter how hard you study. Another 40% comes from 2 essays based off of books. You can get a Low B on these if you really try your hardest.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He is unclear about what he wants for each class. He gives pop quizzes based on the readings once a week in the form of one or two short answer questions. His tests are five vocabulary terms and an essay. He does not respect his students. He is blatantly rude in front of classmates and makes it hard to participate because of this.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Amazing teacher. You have three tests. One paper (get two attempts). He lectures a lot and if you miss you will fail. A lot of stuff he says in class is on the test. Study the study guide. The textbook is online and for free. Pop quizzes every week on the reading the night before so ALWAY read.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Gives wonderful lectures that are informative and always start with a song from the time period you're talking about. He's easy to pass if you do the readings and pay attention in class. Not too many extraneous assignments, and pretty straightforward. Got my next history professor recommendation from him and I'm excited about it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Way genuinely loves history and you can tell! His lectures are kind of long and can be boring. 3 tests. Last of 3 is the final and not cumulative, so thats a plus! Pop quizzes every Thursday. 1 mandatory paper opportunity each month, and a library dig. Textbook is free, but chapters are super long and have to be read before quizzes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Way is a really charismatic guy. His classes are lecture based, but he has really good and detailed ppts. He talks at a good pace and does not get off topic or go into tangents, so it is really easy to follow him. If you can just listen to a professor talk about what he enjoys for an hour and fifteen minutes, this is the class for you
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is a very knowledgable professor and I enjoy his class. He does require a lot though and it a tough grader. We had a midterm final and then 2 papers and quizzes. I have never made a c on a college paper until this class. Not an easy grade. For the test if pretty much requires you to remeber all the material from the notes. But good class.

I made four A's this past semester with 3 of them being above a 95. I barely made a B in his History 2112 class. There were two books with essays and his tests were extremely broad. I would recommend you take him ONLY if you are a history major and if it's required.

Professor Way knows his history, but the class is pretty boring and I struggled to stay awake quite a few times! His tests are not easy, I've always made good grades and only made an A on one of his tests. He grades tough but fairly and if you're willing to put in the work you'll make a decent grade. You really have to work for an A though.

Dr. Way is an excellent professor who exudes intelligence! He grades fairly and consistently and is invested in the success of each of his students. I found that he made the class very interesting and engaging through his teaching style. Overall, I loved the course and would love to take another class taught by him if given the chance.

Dr. Way is an excellent professor. He requires a lot from his students, however, he is fair and gives help when needed. There is a lot of reading for this course and several papers and a research project. This was my favorite class, but required the most work. I would definitely take another class from this professor.

Nice guy, but his class is pointlessly difficult. It's not overtly hard, just kind of tedious. Mandatory attendance. Tests are essay format which he grades pretty harshly, reading quizzes almost every class,two book essays and a "site analysis". Doesn't let class out early. Never cancels. It's a class you have to work in. I love history and got a C

This class was very interesting, and Way is great. He keeps things interesting and although his tests are hard, if you follow his guide and take a lot of notes, you will do great! I wish I could take him again in another class!
AMAZING!! Dont miss out on his class. He truly loves what he is talking about and if you try he will try to get you the best grade possible.

Professor Way absolutely loves to teach about the South. His lectures are easy to follow, but he sometimes stalls for time. Often times, he appeared nervous in front of class. His Exams are all essay format, so be prepared to do a lot of writting. There is one book review you must complete. Attendence is expected for the class. Take good notes.

Take Him! He brings in different resources like music and movies about the period of time. His tests can be challenging but he grades fairly based upon the amount of knowledge you know about the subject. You have 3 tests, an Essay, and some quizzes. He's straightforward, knows what he's talking about, if he doesn't he'll tell you and will find out
Terrible. No confidence in front of a class. There is no "guide provided" to his tests, so don't ask. Grades ridiculously (not fairly). Doesn't belong in the classroom. Don't take him.

TAKE THIS TEACHER. Way is, hands down, one of the best professors I've had at KSU. He made History interesting & while a lot is asked of you, it's not difficult work. I had to write 5 one page reactions, double-spaced, over essays in the book. Also, show up to class everyday because they're are pop quizzes & fill out the study guide for the tests.

Great Prof. Thought I would be bored in GA hist but I really enjoyed his class and learned so much. Was an upper level class, therefore upper level work is required. If you want a slack class keep moving, if you want to take a class you will enjoy and learn in, absolutely recommend him! Really gave me a new perspective on state hist in general.

Dr. Way is awesome! He is my kind of history professor as he encourages us to look at the bigger themes and not so much the trivial aspects of history such as the exact dates. He is funny and just plain nice. Grade is made up of 3 tests (guide provided), several quizzes, discussion posts, short paper, and attendance. Take him if you can!
amazing!!!! take him! he was the best professor I've had yet!
AMAZING! He was funny, knowledgeable, and made class fun to go to! definitely take him! Probably my favorite professor so far
